messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Travel and host families question
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.usservas.org/ Is that it maybe? Kelli ... From: Have a Nice Day!  To:  Sent: Wednesday,
messages.messageBody:
http://www.usservas.org/



Is that it maybe?

Kelli


----- Original Message -----
From: "Have a Nice Day!" <litlrooh@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 30, 2003 11:22 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Travel and host families question


> What was the name of that organization that sets up host families for
travelers, and also allows you to act as a host too...
>
> I can't remember!!
>
> Kristen
> ****************************************************************
>
> Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and
"tomorrow" might never come.
>
> Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better
than yesterday.
>
> The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if
it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Travel and host families question
messages.msgSnippet: What was the name of that organization that sets up host families for travelers, and also allows you to act as a host too... I can t remember!! Kristen
messages.messageBody:
What was the name of that organization that sets up host families for travelers, and also allows you to act as a host too...

I can't remember!!

Kristen
****************************************************************

Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.

Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better than yesterday.

The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
